com.mumfrey.liteloader.util

Class Input

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mumfrey.liteloader.util.Input
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CoreProvider, Observer, PostRenderObserver, ShutdownObserver, TickObserver, WorldObserver

    public final class Input
extends java.lang.Object
implements CoreProvider
    Mod input class, aggregates functionality from LiteLoader's mod key registration functions and JInputLib
    Author:
    Adam Mummery-Smith

      • onInit

        Specified by:
        onInit in interface CoreProvider

      • onPostInit

        public void onPostInit(GameEngine<?,?> engine)
        Description copied from interface: CoreProvider
        During the postInit phase, the mods which were discovered during preInit phase are initialised and the interfaces are allocated. This callback is invoked at the very start of the postInit phase, before mods are initialised but after the point at which it is safe to assume it's ok to access game classes. This is the first point at which the Minecraft game instance should be referenced. Be aware that certain game classes (such as the EntityRenderer) are NOT initialised at this point.
        Specified by:
        onPostInit in interface CoreProvider

      • onPostInitComplete

        public void onPostInitComplete(LiteLoaderMods mods)
        Description copied from interface: CoreProvider
        Once the mods are initialised and the interfaces have been allocated, this callback is invoked to allow the CoreProvider to perform any tasks which should be performed in the postInit phase but after mods have been initialised.
        Specified by:
        onPostInitComplete in interface CoreProvider

      • onStartupComplete

        public void onStartupComplete()
        Description copied from interface: CoreProvider
        Called once startup is complete and the game loop begins running. This callback is invoked immediately prior to the first "tick" event and immediately AFTER the the "late init" phase for mods (InitCompleteListener)
        Specified by:
        onStartupComplete in interface CoreProvider

      • onJoinGame

        public void onJoinGame(INetHandler netHandler,
                       S01PacketJoinGame loginPacket)
        Description copied from interface: CoreProvider
        Called immediately on joining a single or multi-player world when the JoinGame packet is received. Only called on the client.
        Specified by:
        onJoinGame in interface CoreProvider

      • getEvent

        public InputEvent getEvent(java.lang.String descriptor,
                           InputHandler handler)
        Returns a handle to the event described by descriptor (or null if no component is found matching the descriptor. Retrieving an event via this method adds the controller (if found) to the polling list and causes it to raise events against the specified handler. This method returns an InputEvent which is passed as an argument to the relevant callback on the supplied handler in order to identify the event. For example: this.joystickButton = input.getEvent(descriptor, this); then in onAxisEvent if (source == this.joystickButton) // do something with button
        Parameters:
        descriptor -
        handler -
        Returns:
